body_html:
Hi I tried your code. But I could not understand why did you unstack y i.e model.total_loss in my case. Your code is giving error: ValueError: Invalid axis: 0; must be in [0,0) for 'unstack_25' (op: 'Unpack') with input shapes: []. This is because model.total_loss has shape: <tf.Tensor 'mul_1:0' shape=() dtype=float32>
…
On Wed, Sep 27, 2017 at 10:31 PM, candidj0 ***@***.***> wrote: Sorry @shaifugpt <https://github.com/shaifugpt>, try this one : def jacobian(y, x, n): y_list = tf.unstack(y, num = n) jacobian_list = [[tf.gradients(y_, x)[0][i] for y_ in tf.unstack(y_list[i])] for i in range(n)] # list [grad(y0, x), grad(y1, x), ...] return y_list, tf.stack(jacobian_list) n is the batch size. — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#675 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AbjabSyDIDMa_6sSXTL-RCxZiB5unfn-ks5smn91gaJpZM4G9_8_> .
body_text:
Hi

I tried your code. But I could not understand why did you unstack y i.e
model.total_loss in my case. Your code is giving error: ValueError: Invalid
axis: 0; must be in [0,0) for 'unstack_25' (op: 'Unpack') with input
shapes: []. This is because model.total_loss has shape: <tf.Tensor
'mul_1:0' shape=() dtype=float32>
…
On Wed, Sep 27, 2017 at 10:31 PM, candidj0 ***@***.***> wrote:
 Sorry @shaifugpt <https://github.com/shaifugpt>, try this one :

 def jacobian(y, x, n):
     y_list = tf.unstack(y, num = n)
     jacobian_list = [[tf.gradients(y_, x)[0][i] for y_ in tf.unstack(y_list[i])] for i in range(n)] # list [grad(y0, x), grad(y1, x), ...]
     return y_list, tf.stack(jacobian_list)

 n is the batch size.

 —
 You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
 Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
 <#675 (comment)>,
 or mute the thread
 <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AbjabSyDIDMa_6sSXTL-RCxZiB5unfn-ks5smn91gaJpZM4G9_8_>
 .
body:
Hi

I tried your code. But I could not understand why did you unstack y i.e
model.total_loss in my case. Your code is giving error: ValueError: Invalid
axis: 0; must be in [0,0) for 'unstack_25' (op: 'Unpack') with input
shapes: []. This is because model.total_loss has shape: <tf.Tensor
'mul_1:0' shape=() dtype=float32>

On Wed, Sep 27, 2017 at 10:31 PM, candidj0 <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> Sorry @shaifugpt <https://github.com/shaifugpt>, try this one :
>
> def jacobian(y, x, n):
>     y_list = tf.unstack(y, num = n)
>     jacobian_list = [[tf.gradients(y_, x)[0][i] for y_ in tf.unstack(y_list[i])] for i in range(n)] # list [grad(y0, x), grad(y1, x), ...]
>     return y_list, tf.stack(jacobian_list)
>
> n is the batch size.
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/675#issuecomment-332586492>,
> or mute the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AbjabSyDIDMa_6sSXTL-RCxZiB5unfn-ks5smn91gaJpZM4G9_8_>
> .
>
